channel.title: AdaptingIT
channel.description: My hope is to bring you some great information on all subjects surrounding Information Technology from some of the best women in the business. Some of the episodes will be very technical while others will focus on some of the careers surrounding technology such as media marketing, tech marketing, management, and PR. Please enjoy!
channel.itunes:author: Lauren Malhoit

item.title: Women with RAM
item.description:
Carrie Reber and Sheryl Koenigsberg

In this episode I talk to Carrie Reber and Sheryl Koenigsberg of Infinio. We talk about how the Infinio Accelerator uses your current memory to create a server-side cache that will help improve performance in your virtual environments.
item.itunes:subtitle: Carrie Reber and Sheryl Koenigsberg In this episode I talk to Carrie Reber and Sheryl Koenigsberg of Infinio. We talk about how the Infinio Accelerator uses your current memory to create a server-side cache that...

item.title: Women with IT Health Care
item.description: Theresa Miller and I chat about what life is really like in the data center of a large health care organization. Check out Theresa's blog and follow her on twitter!
item.itunes:subtitle: Theresa Miller and I chat about what life is really like in the data center of a large health care organization. Check out Theresa's blog and follow her on twitter!

item.title: Women with IT Health Care
item.description: Theresa Miller and I chat about what life is really like in the data center of a large health care organization. Check out Theresa's blog and follow her on twitter!
item.itunes:subtitle: Theresa Miller and I chat about what life is really like in the data center of a large health care organization. Check out Theresa's blog and follow her on twitter!

item.title: Women With O Drive
item.description: Julia Mak is the head Vanguard for OxygenCloud.  Find out how OxygenCloud is making waves in file sharing and syncing for end users and businesses!
item.itunes:subtitle: Julia Mak is the head Vanguard for OxygenCloud.  Find out how OxygenCloud is making waves in file sharing and syncing for end users and businesses!

item.title: Women with Global Reach
item.description: Phoummala Schmitt (aka Exchange Goddess, aka Agent P) and I discuss working in a large enterprise with highly available datacenters in multiple countries.  Follow Phoummala on twitter and read her blog here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Phoummala Schmitt (aka Exchange Goddess, aka Agent P) and I discuss working in a large enterprise with highly available datacenters in multiple countries.  Follow Phoummala on twitter and read her blog here.

item.title: Women with Scale-out Storage
item.description:
Tiffany To
1/8/2014
Tiffany To, of Coho Data and I chat about their product DataStream 1000.  Coho is a really awesome startup using scale-out storage combined with open source innovations.    Follow Coho Data on Twitter.  Also check out the Storage Field Day 4 videos here!
item.itunes:subtitle: Tiffany To 1/8/2014 Tiffany To, of Coho Data and I chat about their product DataStream 1000.  Coho is a really awesome startup using scale-out storage combined with open source innovations.    Follow Coho Data on Twitter....

item.title: Women with Hives
item.description: Abby Strong of AeroHive and I chat about how AeroHive does wireless networking.  Follow Abby on Twitter here and follow AeroHive here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Abby Strong of AeroHive and I chat about how AeroHive does wireless networking.  Follow Abby on Twitter here and follow AeroHive here.

item.title: Girls Gone Wireless
item.description: Jennifer Huber and I talk about wireless in general and new things coming in the wireless realm such as 802.11ac (gig wireless).  Follow Jennifer on Twitter @JenniferLucille and check out her blog here!
item.itunes:subtitle: Jennifer Huber and I talk about wireless in general and new things coming in the wireless realm such as 802.11ac (gig wireless).  Follow Jennifer on Twitter @JenniferLucille and check out her blog here!

item.title: More Chicago VMUG with Mike Foley
item.description: Mike Foley of VMware joins me to talk about his session at the Chicago VMUG as well as security in general at VMware.  Stay tuned after to hear a bit about PluralSight as well!
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike Foley of VMware joins me to talk about his session at the Chicago VMUG as well as security in general at VMware.  Stay tuned after to hear a bit about PluralSight as well!

item.title: Chicago VMUG Leaders
item.description: Chris Wahl, Eric Shanks, Brian Suhr, and Kasia Lorenc join me at the Chicago VMUG to talk about tech in Chicago and what it's like to organize a large event.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Wahl, Eric Shanks, Brian Suhr, and Kasia Lorenc join me at the Chicago VMUG to talk about tech in Chicago and what it's like to organize a large event.

item.title: AdaptingIT: Chicago VMUG Part 1
item.description: Amy Manley and Nick Colyer join me to talk about their session on vCenter Orchestrator at the Chicago VMUG.  Check out their blogs at http://virtualchick.com/ and http://v-nick.com/ .
item.itunes:subtitle: Amy Manley and Nick Colyer join me to talk about their session on vCenter Orchestrator at the Chicago VMUG.  Check out their blogs at http://virtualchick.com/ and http://v-nick.com/ .

item.title: Women with Rapport
item.description: Sunshine Mugrabi and I chat about "hacking communications" in this episode of AdaptingIT.  Sunshine is a professional communicator who's spent a lot of time around the tech industry.  She's got some really awesome ideas about how to work with people and gives away a lot of secrets from her training in this show!  9/25/13
item.itunes:subtitle: Sunshine Mugrabi and I chat about "hacking communications" in this episode of AdaptingIT.  Sunshine is a professional communicator who's spent a lot of time around the tech industry.  She's got some really awesome ideas about how to work...

item.title: VMworld 2013 Special
item.description: Magnus Nilsson and Jonas Rosland of EMC join me to discuss their VMworld session on vCenter Orchestrator, Razor, and ViPR.  Check  out their blog and follow them on twitter @swevm (Magnus) and @virtualswede (Jonas).
item.itunes:subtitle: Magnus Nilsson and Jonas Rosland of EMC join me to discuss their VMworld session on vCenter Orchestrator, Razor, and ViPR.  Check  out their blog and follow them on twitter @swevm (Magnus) and @virtualswede (Jonas).

item.title: Women with Packets
item.description:
Eyvonne Sharp and I talk about her transition from the SMB to the enterprise as a senior network engineer.  Eyvonne gives advice to those looking to make the same move.  Check out Eyvonne's blog here and follow her on Twitter!
http://www.esharp.net/
https://twitter.com/SharpNetwork
item.itunes:subtitle: Eyvonne Sharp and I talk about her transition from the SMB to the enterprise as a senior network engineer.  Eyvonne gives advice to those looking to make the same move.  Check out Eyvonne's blog here and follow her on...

item.title: Women with Operational Experience
item.description: Carolyn Rowland, an IT manager at NIST, and I talk about IT operations education, or lack there of, currently available.  Carolyn is a BOD member for USENIX and is a co-chair for the Women in Advanced Computing (WiAC).  Please follow Carolyn on Twitter here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Carolyn Rowland, an IT manager at NIST, and I talk about IT operations education, or lack there of, currently available.  Carolyn is a BOD member for USENIX and is a co-chair for the Women in Advanced Computing (WiAC).  Please follow Carolyn...

item.title: Women with Ties to the Community
item.description: Amy Lewis and I chat in the middle of the social media hub at Cisco Live in Orlando about everything under the sun.  We talk about community development, Cisco Live, and women in IT among other things.  Check out Amy on Twitter here.  Check out Amy's other podcasts: Engineers Unplugged and Geek Whisperers.
item.itunes:subtitle: Amy Lewis and I chat in the middle of the social media hub at Cisco Live in Orlando about everything under the sun.  We talk about community development, Cisco Live, and women in IT among other things.  Check out Amy on Twitter here....

item.title: Women with Stacked Teams
item.description:
Niki Acosta of RackSpace and I chat about OpenStack.  Check out the RackSpace blog and get started with private cloud in your own network here.
http://www.rackspace.com/ - rackspace
http://www.rackspace.com/blog/ - blog
http://www.rackspace.com/cloud/private/ - Get started
http://www.openstack.org/ - OpenStack

item.title: Women with Flashy Companies
item.description: Listen to Jagreet Saigal and I discuss server-side flash and PernixData's startup software, FVP.
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen to Jagreet Saigal and I discuss server-side flash and PernixData's startup software, FVP.

item.title: Women with Cloud Clarity
item.description:
Alicia Gaba and Diana Nolting

In this episode Alicia, Diana, and I talk about BlueLock, a company that offers cloud IaaS services.  As they put it: "Virtual Centers in the Cloud."  To find out more information check out their blog.  To follow them on twitter, click on their names above.  And to check them out on LinkedIn, click here for Alicia and here for Diana.
item.itunes:subtitle: Alicia Gaba and Diana Nolting In this episode Alicia, Diana, and I talk about BlueLock, a company that offers cloud IaaS services.  As they put it: "Virtual Centers in the Cloud."  To find out more information check out...

item.title: Women with Skills
item.description: Liselotte Foverskov and I talk about all things System Admin!  We also talk about her role as a leader in the Denmark VMUG.  Follow Liselotte on Twitter.
item.itunes:subtitle: Liselotte Foverskov and I talk about all things System Admin!  We also talk about her role as a leader in the Denmark VMUG.  Follow Liselotte on Twitter.

item.title: Women with Private Clouds
item.description:
Alex Maier

Alex Maier, of Nebula, and I talk about Nebula's private cloud appliance in this episode.  If you're interested in OpenStack, Nebula, or cloud in general, this is the podcast for you!
item.itunes:subtitle: Alex Maier Alex Maier, of Nebula, and I talk about Nebula's private cloud appliance in this episode.  If you're interested in OpenStack, Nebula, or cloud in general, this is the podcast for you!

item.title: Women With C-Level Heads
item.description:
Carole McCluskey

Check out my interview with the CTO of Coinstar, Carole McCluskey.  Carole talks about her role of CTO/CIO for the company that puts out Coinstar and RedBox Kiosks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Carole McCluskey Check out my interview with the CTO of Coinstar, Carole McCluskey.  Carole talks about her role of CTO/CIO for the company that puts out Coinstar and RedBox Kiosks.

item.title: Women with Hackathons
item.description:
Girls In Tech: Toronto

Lucia Mariani-Vena and Neha Khera join me to talk about their group Girls in Tech: Toronto.  They tell us about past and future events.  Follow them on Twitter here and find out more about them on the web, FaceBook, and LinkedIn.  Also check on these events from GIT:  Let's Make History and session topics for Canada 3.0.
item.itunes:subtitle: Girls In Tech: Toronto Lucia Mariani-Vena and Neha Khera join me to talk about their group Girls in Tech: Toronto.  They tell us about past and future events.  Follow them on Twitter here and find out more about them on the web,...

item.title: April Fool's Day Special
item.description: Michaela...err...Mike Laverick and I have a bit of fun in the first couple minutes of this podcast.  We actually do get into tech, though.  You'll hear all about vCloud Director/Connector and Bare Metal Cloud!  Check out his site: mikelaverick.com

item.title: Women With Eyes on the Horizon
item.description: Cyndie Zikmund and I discuss the new VMware Horizon Suite along with VDI and application delivery in general.  Check out more information here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cyndie Zikmund and I discuss the new VMware Horizon Suite along with VDI and application delivery in general.  Check out more information here.

item.title: Women with SEO Appeal
item.description:
JJ DiGeronimo and I talk about how she got into cloud, the book she authored, and several groups that she is involved with and runs.  She also shares with us a new giveaway about enhancing your brand.  Click here to find out more!

Check out more on JJ here.

item.title: Women with Big Backups
item.description: Irina Lentsner and I talk about the role of the pre-sales engineer, backups, and Veeam.  Click on the link above to see more about the new Veeam Cloud Edition!
item.itunes:subtitle: Irina Lentsner and I talk about the role of the pre-sales engineer, backups, and Veeam.  Click on the link above to see more about the new Veeam Cloud Edition!

item.title: Women with Q n' A
item.description:
Brea Day is an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst.  Brea talks about what QA is and why it's necessary.  Follow @Brea_Day

If you're interested in researching more, check these links:  Black and White Box Testing, Fiddler, Firebug, Link Validators, XML Sitemaps, Markup Validation

item.title: Women with Dongles
item.description: Jane Rimmer, founder of hiviz-marketing, joins me this week to discuss VMUG leadership, working with tech companies, tech marketing and social media.  Check out Jane's blog here: http://www.rimmergram.com/
item.itunes:subtitle: Jane Rimmer, founder of hiviz-marketing, joins me this week to discuss VMUG leadership, working with tech companies, tech marketing and social media.  Check out Jane's blog here: http://www.rimmergram.com/

item.title: Women With Virtually Everything
item.description: Glenda Canfield is an expert on virtualization in the enterprise and has more than 13 years of experience designing and supporting on-demand data centers.  We talk about BYOD, VDI, and application delivery in this episode!
item.itunes:subtitle: Glenda Canfield is an expert on virtualization in the enterprise and has more than 13 years of experience designing and supporting on-demand data centers.  We talk about BYOD, VDI, and application delivery in this episode!

item.title: Women with Rebellious Tendencies
item.description:
Susan Gudenkauf

VCP #1, Susan Gudendauf and I talk about tech careers, her current position in Customer Experience, and Traumatic Brain Damage.  Seriously.  Follow Susan on Twitter @susangude
item.itunes:subtitle: Susan Gudenkauf VCP #1, Susan Gudendauf and I talk about tech careers, her current position in Customer Experience, and Traumatic Brain Damage.  Seriously.  Follow Susan on Twitter @susangude
